intro: Acritopappus stenophyllus, commonly known as the narrow-leaf acritopappus, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought conditions. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in a fine layer of hair, which helps reduce water loss. The flowers are small and clustered, contributing to its ecological role in pollination and seed dispersal.
